title: Open-Ended Project-Based Learning for Procedural Programming and Software Design Competency Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Basic programming syntax and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Process where healthcare/legal/technical professionals acquire software design and procedural programming skills to improve work efficiency. Conducted in smartphone-based limited technical environments

learning_goals: Learners can design small-scale software with step-by-step algorithms implemented by applying procedural programming principles
Learners can demonstrate decision-making capabilities throughout the entire process from open-ended problem definition to implementation
Learners can understand and apply diverse approaches to software design processes through peer feedback

resources: Mobile-Compatible Development Tools (Thonkable, App Lab, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
